messages.subject: Re: toy boxes
messages.msgSnippet: ... blankets ... bright little ... to see what ... toy box.  Why ... along them ... Another idea is to ... We ditched the toy box a few years ago and got
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, we3deeves@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 7/11/2004 2:37:18 PM Central Standard Time,
> unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
> >> He wants the toys out of the toybos so he can put all of his
blankets
> inside and make a little bed out of it -
> ***I think toy boxes are much better suited for this...he's a
bright little
> kid and probably has already figured this out, too! : ) It's hard
to see what
> you've got to play with if they're all on top of each other in a
toy box. Why
> not build or build some low shelves so you can set the toys out
along them
> where he can see them and also they are more easily stowed?
Another idea is to
> get a large cardboard box for him to build a bed in instead :)
>

We ditched the toy box a few years ago and got containers instead.
They are the clear drawers that stack. The toys are organized into
different drawers, legos, cars, robots, people etc. so my son can
easily find what he wants without having to dump a whole toy box to
find it. It makes clean up easy for me too.

Christy

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] toy boxes
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks so much!!  Looking forward to trying out my new additude! ... inside and make a little bed out of it - ***I think toy boxes are much better suited for
messages.messageBody:
Thanks so much!! Looking forward to trying out my new additude!


>> He wants the toys out of the toybos so he can put all of his blankets
inside and make a little bed out of it -
***I think toy boxes are much better suited for this...he's a bright little
kid and probably has already figured this out, too! : ) It's hard to see what
you've got to play with if they're all on top of each other in a toy box. Why
not build or build some low shelves so you can set the toys out along them
where he can see them and also they are more easily stowed? Another idea is to
get a large cardboard box for him to build a bed in instead :)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/11/2004 2:37:18 PM Central Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
>> He wants the toys out of the toybos so he can put all of his blankets
inside and make a little bed out of it -
***I think toy boxes are much better suited for this...he's a bright little
kid and probably has already figured this out, too! : ) It's hard to see what
you've got to play with if they're all on top of each other in a toy box. Why
not build or build some low shelves so you can set the toys out along them
where he can see them and also they are more easily stowed? Another idea is to
get a large cardboard box for him to build a bed in instead :)
